channel.title: Win 7 64 bit error
channel.description:
Recently my Desktop running Windows xp 32 bit which I've used for a long time coding crashed forcing me to use my Windows 7 64 bit Laptop to code. Every-time I run a client I log in take 2 steps(literally) and I get this crash error. [code]# # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d847786, pid=7020, t id=6908 # # JRE version: 6.0_21-b07 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (17.0-b17 mixed mode windows-amd64 ) # Problematic frame: # V [jvm.dll+0x57786] # # An error report file with more information is saved as: # ***********NOT IMPORTANT*********** g # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp # Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I was told to try downloading Java 32 bit, I did that still did it, re-booted. Still did it. No matter what I've tried. It still does it. I searched around and they said the same thing, download Java 32 bit. But there has to be some other way...
This is not just 1 client, it does it for all clients. 317, 474, 508, 525, 614, ect. I can load and play Webclients fine, but I hate using them. Any suggestions to help me?

item.title: Win 7 64 bit error
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Recently my Desktop running Windows xp 32 bit which I’ve used for a long time coding crashed forcing me to use my Windows 7 64 bit Laptop to code. Every-time I run a client I log in take 2 steps(literally) and I get this crash error.

[code]#

A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:

EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d847786, pid=7020, t

id=6908

JRE version: 6.0_21-b07

Java VM: Java HotSpot™ 64-Bit Server VM (17.0-b17 mixed mode windows-amd64

)

Problematic frame:

V [jvm.dll+0x57786]

An error report file with more information is saved as:

NOT IMPORTANT

g

If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:

http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp

Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

I was told to try downloading Java 32 bit, I did that still did it, re-booted. Still did it. No matter what I’ve tried. It still does it. I searched around and they said the same thing, download Java 32 bit. But there has to be some other way…

This is not just 1 client, it does it for all clients. 317, 474, 508, 525, 614, ect. I can load and play Webclients fine, but I hate using them. Any suggestions to help me?
